title: Skill Shot Practice Tool
body:
I don't know about anyone else, but how cool would it be to have a skill shot practice tool? Players can be bombarded with skill shots and work on their dodging. You can make it so there's an option for dodging while farming/fighting or just out of combat. You could also practice hitting skill shots on moving targets rather than immobile scarecrows that don't fight back.

There are too many players who are just crap at this (myself included) and that need to work on it to make games more challenging and fun.

What do you guys think?

replies.body: That would be a funny minigame. If you're put in an arena with 1 enemy, or more. Then there are just a bunch of skillshots that come from the sides and things in the arena. Last one standing wins lol
Riot just found a new game mode idea.

Doom Bots style where Devil Teemo was shooting global shots.
That was scary af.

URF and Doom Bots is the closest thing we can get for things like these.

Though if we can get something like this implemented in Practice Mode, that would be fine too.

ARAM is good for that, but yeah, I agree that would be nice.  I am a Blitzcrank magnet for whatever reason when I'm playing an ADC, but I can simply side step them when I'm the support.  Would love to have some type of game mode where I could practice CSing while having Blitzcrank hooks shot at me, even from weird angles.
